Motivation Erik Wilde: Utility and Use of APIs: From Vision to Value

(3) AI needs APIs

  1. APIs for consumption by AI
    • GPT Actions provide access to external information sources
    • MCP provides a plug-in model fo accessing data sources
  2. APIs for AI-powered services
    • AI tooling for easier creation of applications
    • AI applications should become building blocks themselves
  3. APIs for data ingestion for AI model training
    • Data contracts with clear terms of service


Motivation Erik Wilde: Utility and Use of APIs: From Vision to Value

(4) APIs & Digital Transformation

  • The digital footprint of organizations is growing
  • More digital building blocks mean more business options
  • Larger organizations have a larger potential to work with
  • Lift APIs from technical interfaces to business value
  • Provide a platform on which APIs are built and consumed

Platform Engineering Erik Wilde: Utility and Use of APIs: From Vision to Value

(6) Platforms!

  • We're building an API platform and will be API First.
  • We're building a platform for our partners.
  • Our developers need a better platform.
  • We're moving to the cloud platform.
  • We want to become a platform.


Platform Engineering Erik Wilde: Utility and Use of APIs: From Vision to Value

(16) API Value

  • More Efficient Development: IDPs for easier API production
  • More Effective Collaboration: API Marketplaces for easier API consumption
  • Digital Transformation: Focus on options, speed, and experimentation
  • Platform Business: Try to become slightly platformy


Business Impact of Platforms Erik Wilde: Utility and Use of APIs: From Vision to Value

(17) Unbundling the Enterprise Creates Options



API Platform Success Factors

  5. Conclusions [2]
API Platform Success Factors Erik Wilde: Utility and Use of APIs: From Vision to Value

(19) Factor #1: Supporting API Production

  • Vision: Everything created has an API
    • Essential for automation and AI integration
  • Strategy: Creating APIs is the default
    • Exceptions are possible but need to be justified
  • Execution: Platform for creating and publishing APIs
    • API design is automated as much as possible
    • API chapter as a way to enable all teams
    • API tooling supports all teams in building/using APIs


API Platform Success Factors Erik Wilde: Utility and Use of APIs: From Vision to Value
